sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: After Ukrainian troops recaptured areas around Kyiv, the extent of destruction in the city of Irpin has been revealed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people have left the town since Russia began its shelling, which is home to about 60,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The military airport in the capital has been heavily damaged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Authorities are urging caution before claiming victory, but say the Kyiv region is gradually returning to Ukrainian hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky says retreating forces are leaving mines across the territory and expects an increase in attacks in the east.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

Russian troops are building up in the Donbas, in the Kharkiv direction. They're preparing for new powerful strikes. We're preparing for even more active defence. We're using all resources, both internal and external." The president of the European Parliament was the first EU official to set foot in Ukraine since the war broke out, visiting parliament which has still been operating despite the fighting. There she made three promises to Ukraine, including help to rebuild its cities and towns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I am here today as representative of the European Parliament, of the people of Europe, to tell you one thing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are with you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian soldiers are clearing Russian troops from villages on the outskirts of Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv. But the damage is already done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia has accused Ukraine of carrying out an airstrike against a fuel depot in the Russian city of Belgorod on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's top security official rebuffed the accusation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Earlier its defense ministry spokesman said he would neither confirm nor deny a Ukrainian role.

sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron received the kidnapped Ukrainian mayor Ivan Fedorov in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The mayor of the southeastern city of Melitopol was taken by Russian forces and held for five days before being released in an exchange deal with Moscow. Our international correspondent Adeliz Borges has been speaking with the freed mayor about his experiences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Amnesty International has raised concerns over the approval to transfer the Turkey trial of suspects in the 2018 murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi to Saudi Arabia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Turkey's Justice Minister has recommended a court to close a trial in absentia against 26 Saudi nationals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: MSD International says the case will be placed under wraps if it is moved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Amazon workers in New York City have voted to unionize, a landmark win as the first successful US organizing effort in the retail giant's history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The victory was an uphill battle for the independent group, made up of former and current workers who lacked official backing from an established union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But organizers believed their grassroots approach was more relatable to workers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Will Smith has stepped down from the Hollywood Film Academy after slapping comedian Chris Rock at the Oscars ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Smith released a statement saying he would accept the consequences for his conduct and called his actions inexcusable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The film academy's president said the resignation was accepted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It now means Smith has lost voting privileges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The leaders of Armenia and Azerbaijan have agreed to meet in Brussels next week to begin new peace talks over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Both leaders met with President Putin in January to maintain a peace deal brokered by Russia in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: With Russia's military bogged down in Ukraine, observers say Azerbaijan has now sensed an opportunity. Both Russia and Armenia say Azeri forces crossed over into an area controlled by Russian peacekeepers last week and seized the strategic village of Paruk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the nearby village of Kramort, Euronews talked to one ethnic Armenian woman who'd fled Paruk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The enemy came and tried to enter our village.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: First they called on us to leave the area via loudspeakers, saying, you're in the territory of Azerbaijan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If you think about the lives of your children, obey our laws, leave this territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now other ethnic Armenians worry about the Russian forces' ability to maintain the ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And reports suggest some of the Russian peacekeepers have left for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow denies this and says it's taking steps to reduce the tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The six-week conflict in 2020 killed thousands of people and saw Azerbaijan gain control of parts of Nagorno-Karabakh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The region is recognized internationally as Azerbaijani, but since 1994 it's been run by ethnic Armenians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now, with Russia's willingness or ability to keep the peace in doubt, many fear for the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: to keep the peace in doubt, many fear for the future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Only God knows what these people saw during the 2020 war. But if no one cares about us now, there must be someone to think about us to pity these people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Armenia does appear quite isolated, regionally at least. Azerbaijan can count on Turkey as a close ally, but Armenia and Turkey have deeply distrusted each other for decades and their border remains closed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now the EU will try to achieve peace in the region in next week's talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Inflation in the Eurozone climbed to 7.5% in March, its highest level since the euro began in 1997.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Union statistics agency Eurostat measured consumer prices in all of the 19 countries that use the currency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: February's rate was 5.9%, which was also a record, as were the four months before that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Eurostat said energy costs rose nearly 45% last month in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: March's rate was the first time that the figure takes into account the war in Ukraine, and it's the clearest sign yet that rising energy prices are squeezing consumers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And prices are rising not only in Europe but across the world, which has the potential to cause social and political unrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Central Bank is now under pressure to raise interest rates, but historically speaking they're still very low, at just 0.5 of a percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ramadan begins when the moon crescent shines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: More than a billion Muslims around the world are celebrating from sunrise on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As the faithful observe a dawn-to-dusk fast, the raging war in Ukraine has cast a shadow over the holy month, with energy and food prices soaring across much of the Arab world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This year Palestinians in Gaza are facing a new hurdle. Prices of staples, even basic ones like bread, have increased along with other essential items like cooking oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Kenya, inflation eroded the average citizen's spending power, and they're bracing for worse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: African countries imported agriculture products worth $4 billion from Russia in 2020, and about 90% of that was wheat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Turkey's mosques are preparing for Ta'ari, a special evening prayer performed during the fasting month of Ramadan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Hagia Sophia Grand in Istanbul is hosting its first in 88 years, after regaining status as a mosque in 2020.
